page.title: 02CATFORTH
page.content: Catforth is a small village that forms part of the parish of Woodplumpton. There is a small village centre but many of the houses are spread out along long, winding lanes. There are several hamlets within the Catforth Ward such as Lewth and Swillbrook, although these lie just outside the area being studied. Catforth is characterised by its large proportion of farms and businesses, both big and small. There are several dairies and milk rounds, also builders, joiners, haulage contractors and suchlike. Many small farms also sell milk, eggs and vegetables to those who want them. PDC Fuels,an oil depot, now stands on the site of what was once a village dance hall.
